results.adx_keywords: Basketball;Anti-Semitism;Social Media;Fines (Penalties);Irving, Kyrie;Brooklyn Nets;Anti-Defamation League
results.title: Nets Suspend Kyrie Irving Indefinitely After Antisemitic Movie Post
results.abstract: Irving posted a link to an antisemitic movie last week but had not apologized until hours after the Nets suspended him for a minimum of five games.

media.caption: Nets guard Kyrie Irving distanced himself from some of the false assertions made in an antisemitic movie he linked to on Twitter last week.

results.adx_keywords: Layoffs and Job Reductions;Social Media;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Computers and the Internet;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Kate Conger and Ryan Mac
results.title: Elon Musk Begins Layoffs at Twitter
results.abstract: The social media company’s 7,500 employees have been bracing for job cuts since Mr. Musk took it over last week.

media.caption: Twitter’s headquarters in San Francisco. About half the company’s 7,500 workers appeared set to lose their jobs.

results.adx_keywords: Layoffs and Job Reductions;Social Media;Computers and the Internet;Labor and Jobs;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Boycotts;News and News Media;Corporate Social Responsibility;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Kate Conger, Ryan Mac and Mike Isaac
results.title: Confusion and Frustration Reign as Elon Musk Cuts Half of Twitter’s Staff
results.abstract: The layoffs hit across many divisions, including the engineering and machine learning units, the teams that manage content moderation, and the sales and advertising departments.

media.caption: On Friday morning, at least nine security guards were seen patrolling Twitter headquarters in San Francisco. Employees had been told to stay home as layoffs were carried out.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Friendship;Domestic Service;Content Type: Personal Profile;Albuquerque (NM);New Mexico
results.title: She Bought the House Her Mother Cleaned for 43 Years
results.abstract: Nichol Naranjo says she was destined to own the house that was a refuge, “a place to come and catch our breath. And to dream.”

media.caption: Margaret Gaxiola, left, was once the housekeeper of the home that her daughter Nichol Naranjo, right, bought in 2020.
media.copyright: John Burcham for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Cooking and Cookbooks;Writing and Writers;Books and Literature;Movies;Blogs and Blogging (Internet);Powell, Julie;Child, Julia
results.byline: By Kim Severson and Julia Moskin
results.title: Julie Powell, Food Writer Known for ‘Julie & Julia,’ Dies at 49
results.abstract: She attempted to cook every recipe in a classic Julia Child cookbook and documented the effort in a popular blog that became a best-selling book and a hit movie.

media.caption: Julie Powell in 2009, the year Nora Ephron's movie “Julie & Julia,” based on Ms. Powell’s book, was released.
media.copyright: Kelly Campbell, via Little, Brown & Company

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2024;Midterm Elections (2022);Trump, Donald J;Grassley, Charles E;Reynolds, Kimberly (1959- );Republican Party;Iowa
results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman
results.title: As Trump Prepares to Announce White House Run, He Tells Iowa Crowd to ‘Get Ready’
results.abstract: The former president, who is expected to announce a third presidential bid shortly after the midterms, opened a swing of four rallies in Iowa.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump greeting Senator Chuck Grassley of Iowa at a rally in Sioux City, Iowa, on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Rocket Science and Propulsion;Tiangong Space Program;Space and Astronomy;Accidents and Safety;China;Pacific Ocean
results.title: China Lucks Out Again as Out-of-Control Rocket Booster Falls in the Pacific
results.abstract: For the fourth time, the country’s space program used a 23-ton launcher that made an uncontrolled re-entry back to Earth, prompting nervous sky-watching and airspace closures in Europe.

media.caption: A Long March 5B rocket lifting off from China’s satellite launch center in Hainan Province on Monday, in an image released by state media.

results.title: New Covid Variants Are Circulating. Here’s What to Know.
results.abstract: The “nightmare variant” is not as bad as it sounds.

results.title: The Israel We Knew Is Gone
results.abstract: Bibi Netanyahu is poised to form a government with allies once seen as completely outside the norms and boundaries of Israeli politics.

results.adx_keywords: Synagogues;Anti-Semitism;Federal Bureau of Investigation;New Jersey
results.byline: By Tracey Tully and Shlomo Schorr
results.title: F.B.I. Locates Suspect After Warning of Security Threat at New Jersey Synagogues
results.abstract: Officials said the man holds “radical extremist views.” On Thursday, they had alerted congregations across the state to be on alert.

media.caption: Police officers stand watch outside the United Synagogue of Hoboken, N.J., on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Decisions and Verdicts;United States Politics and Government;Foreign Agents Registration Act;al-Malik, Rashid;Barrack, Thomas J Jr;Colony Capital LLC;Justice Department;United States;United Arab Emirates
results.title: Former Trump Adviser Acquitted on Charges of Acting as Emirati Agent
results.abstract: Thomas J. Barrack Jr., a Los Angeles businessman and friend of the former president, had been accused of working on behalf of the oil-rich nation without disclosing it.

media.caption: Thomas J. Barrack Jr. was one of several associates of Mr. Trump to come under legal and ethical scrutiny for their dealings with foreign interests.
media.copyright: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Actors and Actresses;Content Type: Personal Profile;Movies;Celebrities;internal-sub-only;audio-neutral-informative;Lawrence, Jennifer;Neugebauer, Lila;Adele (Singer)
results.title: Who Is Jennifer Lawrence Now?
results.abstract: The Oscar-winning “Hunger Games” actress is free from her franchise commitments. But after a brief hiatus from acting, what will she do next?

media.caption: “I obviously cannot relate to risking my life for my country,” Jennifer Lawrence said, “but I can understand, reading ‘Causeway,’ why I’m getting so emotional about somebody who doesn’t feel like they belong anywhere unless they’re on a schedule.”
media.copyright: Robbie Lawrence for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;World Series;Verlander, Justin;Pena, Jeremy (1997- );Altuve, Jose;Syndergaard, Noah;Houston Astros;Philadelphia Phillies
results.byline: By James Wagner and Doug Mills
results.title: Astros on the Verge of a Dynasty After Game 5 Win Over Phillies
results.abstract: Justin Verlander finally got his first World Series victory, Jeremy Peña carried the offense and Houston has Philadelphia on the ropes as it heads home for Game 6.

media.caption: Justin Verlander came into the game with an 0-6 lifetime record in the World Series. With five solid innings on Thursday, he secured his first win in the Fall Classic.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Corporate Social Responsibility;Advertising and Marketing;Computers and the Internet;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Mike Isaac and Ryan Mac
results.title: Elon Musk, Under Financial Pressure, Pushes to Make Money From Twitter
results.abstract: The billionaire and his advisers have discussed adding paid direct messages, fees to watch videos and other features to the service.

media.caption: Twitter’s headquarters in San Francisco. Last year, the company had less money in cash flow than what it now owes its lenders annually.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;James, Letitia;Epshteyn, Boris;Trump Organization;Palm Beach (Fla)
results.byline: By Jonah E. Bromwich, Maggie Haberman, Ben Protess and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump Files a Suit Against N.Y.’s Attorney General, and Against Advice
results.abstract: The case, filed in Florida, seeks to stop Letitia James’s lawsuit in New York and includes Mr. Trump’s signature rhetoric. His legal advisers are split on the wisdom of filing it.

media.caption: The Florida suit includes boasts about the former president’s business and insults directed at his opponents.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.title: The Housing Market Is Worse Than You Think
results.abstract: Buyers, sellers and renters are in for more twists and turns, as soaring mortgage rates and stubborn inflation signal belt tightening ahead.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Midterm Elections (2022);Winfrey, Oprah
results.byline: By Trip Gabriel and Katie Glueck
results.title: Oprah Winfrey Supports Fetterman Over Oz in Pennsylvania’s Senate Race
results.abstract: Ms. Winfrey was instrumental in the rise of Dr. Mehmet Oz, the celebrity television doctor and Republican Senate nominee, but she has announced her support for John Fetterman, his Democratic opponent.

media.caption: Oprah Winfrey said she would have already voted for Lt. Gov. John Fetterman during a virtual midterms-focused event late Thursday.

results.title: Nets Say Kyrie Irving’s Apology Isn’t Enough, and Nike Suspends Its Ties
results.abstract: Irving was suspended after he would not say he held no antisemitic beliefs. Nike suspended its relationship with him Friday.

media.caption: Until he was suspended Thursday, Nets guard Kyrie Irving had resisted calls to apologize for linking to an antisemitic film on Twitter.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Applegate, Christina
results.title: Christina Applegate Pours One Out for ‘Dead to Me’
results.abstract: Diagnosed with multiple sclerosis during filming of the show’s final season, Applegate was determined to finish the story. She said it was the hardest thing she’s ever done.

media.caption: Christina Applegate in the final season of “Dead to Me,” premiering Nov. 17 on Netflix. “This is the first time anyone’s going to see me the way I am,” she said.
